_header: Man if that thou wilt flee sin / Never more to come therein
Note:
Part of the ‘Continuation’ of Handlyng Synne (1283), for which see Sullivan (1978)
XSullivan, S. A. “Handlyng Synne in Its Tradition: A Study of Robert Mannyng of Brunne’s Handlyng Synne and Its Relation to Other Instructional Works, in Order to Establish the Place of the Poem in Its Genre.” Diss. Cambridge, 1978. Other sections are 378, 1598, 3099, 3339, 3358.
_description: The Seven Virtues opposed to the Seven Deadly Sins, illustrated by Narrationes — 454 lines in couplets

CULIi49.First Lines:
Man if þat þu wylt fle synneNeuer more to come þer
                    Inne…
CULIi49.Last Lines:
…Þat god in heuen plesyd beAmen Ame ffor
                    Charyte
CULIi49.Attributed Title:
Hec sunt virtutes Septem. Prima virtus humilitas (f. 165);
                        Expliciunt vij medicine contra peccata mortalia (f. 173)

BLHar3954.First Lines: Man ȝyf þat þu wylt fle synneNeuer more to come þerInne…
BLHar3954.Last Lines: …And for our synnus ofte to wepeþat god in heuene may plecyd beAmen Amen for charyte
BLHar3954.Attributed Title: Hec sunt vii virtutes contra vii vices Prima humilitas contra superbiam (rubric above first line, f. 78va); Explicit Medicina contra peccata (below last line, f. 80rb)
